C:
One space high approach.

[src:dobj,II p. 2]: Was occasionally seen but not standard in pre-modern games, due to lack of emphasis on territory. Favourably re-evaluated in modern times.

_children.C:
Attachment by black, by far one of the most common responses to white's approach.

Some complex variations such as the small and large avalanche might arise from this position were White to continue with, 2.

[src:dobj, p. 8]: The most orthodox response, secures the corner.
[src:dobj]: Shows a positive approach; of course, quite different from a pincer on the keima kakari. White only rarely ignores this pincer.

Nickname: â€œThe magic sword of Muramasaâ€

This move is usually played when Black has a stone in the adjacent corner, such as [d16] or [d17], otherwise [M16] will be in a bad spot and liable to be counter-pincered at the right moment.

[src:dobj,II p. 106]: Relatively modern (as of 1975). A severe restrictive move. Some White responses have hair-raising variations.

Played when territory is more important, or when the right side is important. If influence is more important [q14] is played instead.

[src:dobj, II p. 6]: Excellent if perhaps a little too steady. Often used by White in komi games.
[src:dobj, II p. 3]: Most peaceful response; aims to balance high kakari; few variations.
[src:dobj, II p. 69]: Used so as not to fall behind in influence.
This move is generally used in Chinese Fuseki.

[src:dobj,II p. 125]: Very rare; seems a little too close but is the severest attack on the White kakari.

1 space high pincer, you can't find it in old games and it leads to immediate battles often.
Seen in pro games in mid 2018.

This is Kitani Minoru's Joseki. It is commonly called thrusting or butting play. Go Seigen approved of this joseki by praising it.

[src:dobj,II p. 129]: A simple. straightforward move.
[src:dobj,II p. 127] (as of 1975): Currently experimental, no joseki yet. Aims to maintain overall balance. Usual answers [q14] or [r15].
Situational move. Black generally prevents a white moyo on the right side.
A valid move black can play.
